A4.text: Before World War II, the events of 1914â€“1918 were commonly referred to as the Great War or simply the World War.

A5.text: The earliest known use of the term First World War appeared in September 1914, when German biologist and philosopher Ernst Haeckel wrote that the ongoing 'European War' would become 'the first world war in the full sense of the word.'
